question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full name of the organization mentioned in the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The full name of the organization is Rural Electrification Corporation Limited (REC Limited).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to invite applications for the post of Executive Director in REC Ltd. on deputation.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the background of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: REC Limited is the nodal agency for implementation of several programmes of the Government of India such as Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) and other Govt. programmes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of experience is required for the post of Executive Director?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post requires experience in managing/handling major infrastructure works in the Power Sector including Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Renewable Energy etc. as well as other major infrastructure projects.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the deputation for the post of Executive Director?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deputation is for a period of three years extendable by another two years.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the post of Executive Director?
question_answer_pairs.answer: IAS officers at the Level 13 or above as per 7th CPC are eligible for the post.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for applying for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Interested and willing IAS officers currently working are requested to forward their names to the Government.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the applications be submitted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applications should be submitted to the undersigned by 31st August 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the regional offices of REC Limited mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The regional offices are Bengaluru, Bhopal, Bhubaneswar, Chennai, Dehradun, Guwahati, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Jammu, Kolkata.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the training center of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training center is REC Institute of Power Management & Training (RECIPMT), Hyderabad.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Chairperson and Managing Director of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Vivek Kumar Dewangan is the Chairperson and Managing Director of REC Limited.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the website of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The website of REC Limited is www.recindia.nic.in.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the corporate office address of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The corporate office address is REC World Headquarters, Plot No. I-4, CBD Belapur, Navi Mumbai - 400614.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the registered office address of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The registered office address is Core-4, SCOPE Complex, 7, Lodhi Road, New Delhi - 110003.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the GST number of REC Limited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST number is 07AAACR1848G1ZD.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are some of the other government schemes that REC Limited is involved in?
question_answer_pairs.answer: REC Limited is involved in schemes like RGGVY (Rajiv Gandhi Grameen Vidyutikaran Yojana), Saubhagya (Pradhanmantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana), DDUGJY (Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana), and UDAY (Ujwal Discom Assurance Yojana).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The RDSS scheme aims to improve the performance of the Distribution Sector.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Rajiv Gandhi Grameen Vidyutikaran Yojana (RGGVY)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The RGGVY scheme aims to provide electricity access to all rural households.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Saubhagya (Pradhanmantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana) scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Saubhagya scheme aims to provide electricity connections to all rural and urban households.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana (DDUGJY) scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DDUGJY scheme aims to strengthen and augment the electricity distribution infrastructure in rural areas.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Ujwal Discom Assurance Yojana (UDAY) scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UDAY scheme aims to improve the financial and operational efficiencies of power distribution companies.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of REC Limited in the implementation of these government schemes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: REC Limited is the nodal agency for the implementation of these schemes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Annual Performance Appraisal Reports (APARs) mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The APARs are required to be submitted for the last five years for the post of Executive Director.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the No Objection Certificate (NoC) requirement for the post of Executive Director?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NoC from the current employer is required to be submitted along with the application.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting the applications for the post of Executive Director?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for submitting the applications is 31st August 2022.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Vivek Kumar Dewangan, the Chairperson and Managing Director of REC Limited, is the signatory of this document.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification provided in this order regarding the existing multi-State cooperative credit societies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The existing multi-State cooperative credit societies which are having area of operation of the various States are not required to get NOC from that particular States/UTs which are already approved in the by-laws by the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has this department informed the RCS of all States/UTs as per the order dated 26
question_answer_pairs.answer: This department vide order dated 26.03.2014 has informed the RCS of all States/UTs that the existing multi-purpose and credit societies shall have to submit NOC from the concerned Registrar for extending any type of activities to the Central Registrar.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition mentioned in the order regarding the approval of bye-laws by the Central Registrar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Once the bye-laws have been approved by the Central Registrar extending any area of operation, no NOC is required from the States concerned to operate in that State/UT by the multi-State cooperative credit societies/multi-purpose cooperative societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document title?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Office Memorandum

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government ministry issued this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ministry of Environment & Forests

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 8th June, 2011

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applications received for prescribing TORs / grant of EC involving land claimed to be owned by different project proponents - Procedure to be followed - Regarding

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the EIA Notification, 2006 require?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006 requires various projects/activities listed therein to obtain requisite prior environmental clearance under the provisions thereof.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has been receiving proposals for prescribing TORs / grant of EC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Environment & Forests / State Environment Impact Assessment Authorities (SEIAAs) have been receiving proposals for prescribing TORs / grant of EC.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the issue regarding the land ownership?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issue of land is primarily one of concern of the State Governments and in order to avoid any litigation at a later date in such cases, it has been decided that the following procedure will be followed.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure to be followed for cases involving common land where no project has been prescribed TORs / granted EC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If, more than one proposal is received for the same land or having land over lapping with other project(s), in part or in full, all such projects will be kept on hold. A written communication will be sent to the Chief Secretary of the concerned State where the project(s) is located, requesting the State Government for specific comments on various contentions made and consequent advice in the matter.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen after the State Government's advice is received?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Only after a formal advice is received regarding the land from the State Government, the proposal(s), if any, in whose favour the advice has been given by the State Government, will be considered by the EAC on merits, recommendations made and decision taken.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure to be followed for cases involving common land where one of the project has already been prescribed the TORs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If, a proposal for prescribing TORs is received involving land in part or in full for which TORs have already been prescribed to some other project, in such a situation the project received for TOR will be kept on hold. A written communication will be sent to the Chief Secretary of the concerned State where the project(s) is located, requesting the State Government for specific comments on various contentions made and consequent advice in the matter.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of sending the written communication to the Chief Secretary?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To request the State Government for specific comments on various contentions made and consequent advice in the matter.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen to the project for which TORs have already been prescribed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The project for which TORs have already been prescribed is kept on hold.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will make the final decision on the proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The EAC on merits, recommendations made and decision taken.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Terms of Reference

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of EC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Environmental Clearance

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of EIA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Environmental Impact Assessment

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of SEIAA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: State Environment Impact Assessment Authorities

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document title?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the circular?
What is the circular number?
What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Regarding the conduct of the Departmental Promotion Committee (DPC) for promotion to the post of Superintendent

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Kerala Secretariat

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide guidelines for conducting the Departmental Promotion Committee (DPC) for promotion to the post of Superintendent

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the main points mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: i) Composition of the DPC, ii) Criteria for promotion, iii) Procedure for DPC, iv) Approval of the DPC recommendations, v) Other instructions

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the members of the DPC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DPC shall consist of the Secretary of the Department, the Head of the Department, and a representative from the General Administration (Services) Department

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the criteria for promotion to the post of Superintendent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Seniority-cum-merit

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the seniority-cum-merit be determined?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Based on the service records and performance appraisal of the candidates

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for the DPC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DPC shall scrutinize the service records and performance appraisal of the eligible candidates and prepare a select list

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the DPC recommendations be approved?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DPC recommendations shall be submitted to the appointing authority for approval

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the other instructions mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Regarding the maintenance of confidentiality, timely conduct of the DPC, and adherence to the reservation policies

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be the appointing authority for the post of Superintendent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The appointing authority shall be the Government

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of maintaining confidentiality in the DPC process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To ensure fairness and objectivity in the selection process

question_answer_pairs.question: Why is it important to conduct the DPC in a timely manner?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To ensure timely promotions and avoid delays

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the reservation policies that need to be followed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reservation policies applicable to the State Government shall be followed

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the select list prepared by the DPC be utilized?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The select list shall be utilized for making promotions to the post of Superintendent

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the validity period of the select list?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The select list shall be valid for one year from the date of its approval

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be responsible for implementing the instructions in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Heads of Departments shall be responsible for implementing the instructions

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of this circular in the context of public administration?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It provides guidelines for a fair and transparent promotion process for the post of Superintendent

question_answer_pairs.question: How does this circular ensure equal opportunity in the promotion process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By following the reservation policies and considering seniority-cum-merit as the criteria

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the General Administration (Services) Department in the DPC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide a representative to the DPC

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular ensure accountability in the promotion process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By requiring the DPC recommendations to be submitted to the appointing authority for approval

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the importance of maintaining confidentiality in the DPC process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To prevent any undue influence or bias in the selection process

question_answer_pairs.question: Why is it necessary to conduct the DPC in a timely manner?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To ensure that eligible employees are promoted without delay

question_answer_pairs.question: How does this circular contribute to the overall efficiency of the public administration system?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By providing a structured and transparent process for promotions

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the potential challenges in implementing the instructions in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ensuring timely conduct of the DPC, maintaining confidentiality, and adherence to reservation policies

question_answer_pairs.question: How does this circular align with the principles of good governance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By promoting fairness, transparency, and accountability in the promotion process

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document provides guidelines for the implementation of the Kerala Panchayat Raj Act and Kerala Municipality Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the key points mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key points include: i) Procedures for the election of Panchayat/Municipal Chairpersons and Vice-Chairpersons, ii) Procedures for the election of Panchayat/Municipal Standing Committee Chairpersons, iii) Procedures for the election of Panchayat/Municipal Council Leaders, and iv) Procedures for the election of Panchayat/Municipal Council Deputy Leaders.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for electing the Panchayat/Municipal Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure involves secret ballot voting by the elected members.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for electing the Panchayat/Municipal Standing Committee Chairpersons?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure involves secret ballot voting by the elected members.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for electing the Panchayat/Municipal Council Leader?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure involves secret ballot voting by the elected members.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for electing the Panchayat/Municipal Council Deputy Leader?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure involves secret ballot voting by the elected members.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Panchayat/Municipal Chairperson?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairperson presides over the meetings and exercises administrative control over the Panchayat/Municipality.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Panchayat/Municipal Vice-Chairperson?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Vice-Chairperson assists the Chairperson and acts on their behalf in their absence.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"RESERVE BANK OF INDIA\".

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the document is March 10, 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number mentioned is RBI/2021-2022/181 A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.27.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to \"All Category - I Authorised Dealer Banks\".

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the bank mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The bank mentioned is Exim Bank's Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Line of Credit (LoC) provided by Exim Bank?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is for procuring and installing 30,000 Solar Home Lighting Systems in the Hinterland Communities in Guyana.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total amount of the Line of Credit (LoC) provided by Exim Bank?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total amount is USD 7.29 million.

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is the Line of Credit (LoC) provided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Line of Credit (LoC) is provided to the Government of Cooperative Republic of Guyana.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the agreement between Exim Bank and the Government of Cooperative Republic of Guyana signed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The agreement was signed on September 29, 2021.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the terminal utilization period of the Line of Credit (LoC)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The terminal utilization period is 60 months from the scheduled completion date of the project.

question_answer_pairs.question: How much of the contract price shall be supplied by the seller from India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: At least 75 percent of the contract price shall be supplied by the seller from India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the remaining percentage of goods and services that may be procured by the seller from outside India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The remaining 25 percent of goods and services may be procured by the seller from outside India.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under the agreement, what is the financing of export of eligible goods and services from India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The financing of export of eligible goods and services from India is allowed subject to their being eligible for export under the Foreign Trade Policy of the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the shipments under the Line of Credit (LoC) be declared?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The shipments under the LoC shall be declared in Export Declaration Form as per instructions issued by the Reserve Bank from time to time.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the effective date of the Agreement under the Line of Credit (LoC)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Agreement under the LoC is effective from February 14, 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is regarding the release of funds under the Scheme of Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances (ADIP Scheme).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total amount of funds being released?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total amount of funds being released is Rs. 4700.24 crore.

question_answer_pairs.question: For which financial year are these funds being released?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The funds are being released for the financial year 2023-24.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the different components of the total funds being released?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The components include Rs. 3000.00 crore for ADIP Scheme, Rs. 1400.00 crore for DDRS Scheme, and Rs. 300.24 crore for SIPDA Scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for utilization of these funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for utilization of these funds is 31.03.2024.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the instructions regarding the release of funds under the ADIP Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The instructions include releasing the funds in two installments, with the first installment of Rs. 2000.00 crore to be released immediately.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the instructions regarding the release of funds under the DDRS Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The instructions include releasing the funds in two installments, with the first installment of Rs. 700.00 crore to be released immediately.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the instructions regarding the release of funds under the SIPDA Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The instructions include releasing the funds in two installments, with the first installment of Rs. 150.12 crore to be released immediately.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the ADIP Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ADIP Scheme is for the Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the DDRS Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DDRS Scheme is for the Deendayal Disabled Rehabilitation Scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the SIPDA Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The SIPDA Scheme is for the Scheme for Implementation of Persons with Disabilities Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submission of Utilization Certificates for the released funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for submission of Utilization Certificates is 15.06.2024.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the release of the second installment of funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The second installment of funds will be released after the submission of Utilization Certificates for the first installment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the monitoring of the utilization of funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The utilization of funds will be monitored by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the submission of progress reports?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Progress reports on the utilization of funds should be submitted to the Ministry on a quarterly basis.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the maintenance of separate accounts for the released funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Separate accounts should be maintained for the funds released under each scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the adherence to the provisions of the Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of the Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 should be adhered to while implementing the schemes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the compliance with the General Financial Rules, 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Financial Rules, 2017 should be complied with while utilizing the released funds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the submission of Utilization Certificates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Utilization Certificates should be submitted in the prescribed format.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the release of funds to the State Governments/UT Administrations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The funds should be released to the State Governments/UT Administrations as per the approved allocation.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the release of funds to the Implementing Agencies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The funds should be released to the Implementing Agencies as per the approved allocation.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the maintenance of records and accounts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Proper records and accounts should be maintained for the utilization of the released funds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the submission of Audited Statements of Accounts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Audited Statements of Accounts should be submitted to the Ministry on an annual basis.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the submission of Quarterly Progress Reports?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Quarterly Progress Reports on the utilization of funds should be submitted to the Ministry.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the submission of Utilization Certificates for the previous year's funds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Utilization Certificates for the previous year's funds should be submitted before the release of the current year's funds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the compliance with the provisions of the Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of the Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 should be complied with while implementing the schemes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the adherence to the General Financial Rules, 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Financial Rules, 2017 should be adhered to while utilizing the released funds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Regarding the implementation of the provisions of the National Identification Authority of India (NIOT) Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide instructions regarding the implementation of the NIOT Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the key points mentioned in the circular regarding the implementation of the NIOT Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular provides instructions on the enrollment process, updating of personal information, and the use of NIOT numbers.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is eligible to apply for NIOT enrollment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All residents of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the enrollment process for NIOT?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Residents can enroll at designated NIOT enrollment centers.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can residents update their personal information in the NIOT database?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Residents can update their information at NIOT enrollment centers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the NIOT number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NIOT number is a unique identification number for each resident, which can be used for various government services and programs.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the validity period of the NIOT number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NIOT number is valid for life.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the benefits of having an NIOT number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NIOT number can be used to access various government services and programs.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can residents obtain their NIOT number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Residents can obtain their NIOT number from the NIOT enrollment centers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the NIOT Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NIOT Act aims to provide a unique identification number to all residents of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the exemption granted by the North DMC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The exemption is for PWD projects to be used for public purpose, from seeking sanction of building plan from the local bodies as per provision of section-3 of Govt. Building Act 1899.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Act under which the exemption is granted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The exemption is granted subject to adherence to the norms of UBBL-2016/MPD-2021, as amended to the Govt. Building Act 1899.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for the exemption granted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PWD projects should be used for public purpose, and they shall give reasonable notice to the local bodies i.e. concerned Zonal Building Deptt. as per provision to Section 3 of the act before erection of the Govt. Buildings.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants as per the Emigration Act, 1983?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To protect and advise all intending emigrants, oversee the provisions of the Emigration Act, 1983 and compliance of rules made thereunder, grant emigration clearance to the intending emigrants as per the procedure prescribed under the Emigration Act, 1983, monitor recruitment activities of RAs, illegal agents under the supervision of the Protector General of Emigrants, inspect any emigrant conveyance or other conveyance, inquire into the treatment received by emigrants and report thereon, and aid and advise emigrants who have returned to India

question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 2 posts available, 1 each at the UIDAI Regional Office, Guwahati and UIDAI Regional Office, Bengaluru.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligibility criteria are: i) Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department; OR Officers with four years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 13 or above; OR Officers from State/UT Government/Public Sector Undertaking/Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience, and ii) Age below 56 years as on the closing date of the application.

question_answer_pairs.question: Is there any requirement for empanelment by the Central Government for applying for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, there is no requirement for empanelment by the Central Government for holding the post of Jt. Secretary or equivalent for applying for this post.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the UIDAI Regional Office, Guwahati located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UIDAI Regional Office, Guwahati is located at Bangla Sahib Road, Behind Kali Mandir, Gole Market, New Delhi - 110001.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 29th June, 2023.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay matrix level for the Deputy Director General (JS equivalent) post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay matrix level for this post is Level 14.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis of appointment for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The appointment is on deputation (Foreign Service term basis).

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can apply for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department; OR Officers with four years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 13 or above; OR Officers from State/UT Government/Public Sector Undertaking/Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for applying for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The age limit is below 56 years as on the closing date of the application.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Level 'D' Training Programme for Section Officers / Under Secretaries in the zone of promotion for Grade I(US) of the CSS at the ISTM from 17/09/2018 (9:30 AM) to 21/09/2018 (5:30 PM) Batch\".

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the officers directed to participate in the Level 'D' Training Programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers whose names are given in Annexure-I have been nominated to participate in the Level 'D' Training Programme.

question_answer_pairs.question: When and where are the officers required to report for the training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers are required to report to Shri Praveen Prakash Agarwal, Deputy Director (Course Director), ISTM, Administrative Block, JNU Campus (Old), New Delhi-110067 at 9:00 A.M. on 17th September, 2018 without fail.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mandatory requirement for the training of the officers and its successful completion?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training of the officers and its successful completion is mandatory as per DOP&T Notification G.S.R.107(E) dated 9th March 2010.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence if the officers do not attend or successfully complete the \"Level 'D'\" training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers who do not attend or successfully complete the \"Level 'D'\" training programme will be liable to debarment and denial of promotion as envisaged in DOP&T OM No.1-25017/1/2015-Trg (ISTM Section) dated 4th July, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for ensuring that the officers re-nominated are relieved in time?

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the performance of the officers in the training be evaluated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The performance of the officers in the training will be evaluated and the reports added in their APARs while considering their promotion.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the \"Level 'D'\" training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the \"Level 'D'\" training programme is for the promotion of the officers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the \"Level 'D'\" training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The \"Level 'D'\" training programme is from 17/09/2018 (9:30 AM) to 21/09/2018 (5:30 PM).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Norms for Teacher Qualifications for appointment as a teacher in classes I to VIII under the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education (RTE) Act 2009 and conduct of Central Teacher Eligibility Test 2011 by the CBSE.

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, what act provides the provisions for the minimum qualifications for a person to be eligible for appointment as a teacher in classes I to VIII?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The RTE Act 2009.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can a copy of the NCTE notification dated 23rd August, 2010 be found?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The copy of the said notification is available on the official website of the NCTE www.ncte-india.org and at www.education.nic.in.

question_answer_pairs.question: What did the NCTE notification dated 23
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NCTE notification provided that one of the essential qualifications for a person to be eligible for appointment as a teacher in any of the schools referred to in clause (n) of section 2 of the RTE Act is that he/she should pass the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) which will be conducted by the appropriate Government in accordance with the Guidelines framed by the NCTE.

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, who has the responsibility of conducting the Central Teacher Eligibility Test (CTET)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India has entrusted the responsibility of conducting the CTET to the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE).

question_answer_pairs.question: Which schools will the CTET conducted by the CBSE be applicable to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CTET conducted by the CBSE is applicable to the schools of the Central Government (KVS, NVS, and Central Tibetan Schools etc.) and schools under the administrative control of UT of Chandigarh and Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the three categories of enterprises based on the investment in plant and machinery or equipment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The three categories are: (i) micro enterprise, (ii) small enterprise, and (iii) medium enterprise.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the investment limit for a micro enterprise in plant and machinery or equipment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The investment in plant and machinery or equipment for a micro enterprise does not exceed one crore rupees.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the investment limit for a small enterprise in plant and machinery or equipment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The investment in plant and machinery or equipment for a small enterprise does not exceed ten crore rupees.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Clarification on the entitlement of input tax credit where the place of supply is determined in terms of the proviso to sub-section (8) of section 12 of the Integrated Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 - reg.\"

question_answer_pairs.question: What section of the IGST Act, 2017 is this circular referring to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is referring to sub-section (8) of section 12 of the Integrated Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the proviso to sub-section (8) of section 12 of the IGST Act, 2017 provide for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The proviso to sub-section (8) of section 12 provides for the place of supply of services by way of transportation of goods, including by mail or courier, where the location of the supplier as well as the recipient of services is in India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the circular state regarding the place of supply of services in cases where the transportation of goods is by a registered person?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that as per the proviso to the aforesaid sub-section, the place of supply of such registered person shall be the location of such registered person.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the circular state regarding the availability of input tax credit to the recipient located in India where the place of supply is outside India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that in such cases, as the place of supply of services, as per the proviso to sub-section (8) of section 12 of IGST Act, is to the concerned foreign destination and not the State where the recipient is registered under GST, doubts are being raised regarding the availability of input tax credit of the said services to the recipient located in India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to clarify the issue and to ensure uniformity in the implementation of the provisions of law across the field formations.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under what section of the CGST Act, 2017 is this circular issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued under section 168 (1) of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The short form used is \"CGST Act\".

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the proviso is to determine the place of supply of services by way of transportation of goods, including by mail or courier, where the location of the supplier as well as the recipient of services is in India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the circular state regarding the location of the supplier and recipient of services in cases where the transportation of goods is by a registered person?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that as per the proviso to the aforesaid sub-section, the location of such registered person shall be the location of the place of supply of services.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the circular state regarding the availability of input tax credit to the recipient located in India where the place of supply is outside India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that in such cases, as the place of supply of services, as per the proviso to sub-section (8) of section 12 of IGST Act, is to the concerned foreign destination and not the State where the recipient is registered under GST, doubts are being raised regarding the availability of input tax credit of the said services to the recipient located in India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide information regarding revalidation of sanctions pertaining to the year 2017-18 and pending for payment as on 31.03.2018.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the three categories of cases mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (A) Drafts sanction order has been approved by FD-III and FD diary no. has been allotted during year 2017-18 but final sanction order could not be issued upto 31.03.

question_answer_pairs.question: (B) Final sanction order has been issued upto 31.03.2018, but bill has not been sent to Finance Division by grants sanctioning bureau. (C) Final sanction order has been issued upto 31.03.2018 and bill has been sent to FD by grants sanctioning bureau but payment could not be made by Finance Division.6. What will happen in the cases mentioned in (A), (B) and (C)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The draft sanction order or final sanction order will be returned by FD-III section to the concerned grants sanctioning bureau after changing the year to 2018-19 from 2017-18 and also after cancellation of earlier diary no. & allotment of new diary no. of year 2018-19.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the grants sanctioning bureau do after receiving the draft sanction order or final sanction order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The grants sanctioning bureau will issue fresh sanction order by cancelling the earlier one, if any, and submit the same with the bill to FD for making the payment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for cases pending in FD-III for allotment of FD diary no
question_answer_pairs.answer: FD-III will make necessary changes in the draft sanction order to make it valid for year 2018-19 instead of year 2017-18 and allot FD diary no. of current financial year. After that file is to be returned to the concerned section for issuance of the final sanction order and preparation of grants-in-aid bill as per usual procedure.
